import React from 'react'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; export default function TestPage() { return (

üß™ Test Page - Online Exam System

Use these links to test different parts of the application without authentication:

üîß Backend Connection Test

Test if the React frontend can connect to Spring Boot backend

Test Connection

üìù Create Exam Test

Test exam creation functionality (saves to database)

Test Exam Creation

üìä Teacher Dashboard Test

Test teacher dashboard (shows created exams with activate/deactivate)

Test Dashboard

üéì Student Exam List Test

Test student view (shows only active exams)

Test Exam List

üìã Exam Summary (Simple)

Simple view to manage all exams with activate/deactivate

Exam Summary

üìù Exam Interface Test

Test the exam taking interface directly

Test Exam Interface

üë• Role-Based Testing:

üë®üè´ Teacher Flow:

  1. Go to Login ‚Üí Click "Login as Teacher"
  2. Create exams and add questions
  3. Activate/Deactivate exams
  4. View exam management dashboard

üéì Student Flow:

  1. Go to Login ‚Üí Click "Login as Student"
  2. View available active exams
  3. Start and take exams
  4. View results and marks

üìã Complete Testing Steps:

  1. Test Connection: Verify backend is running and accessible
  2. Teacher Login: Login as teacher and create exams
  3. Activate Exam: Activate exam in teacher dashboard
  4. Student Login: Login as student and take exam
  5. View Results: Check marks and detailed results

‚ö†Ô∏è Prerequisites:

  • Spring Boot server running on port 9090
  • MySQL server running with 'projectdb' database
  • React app running on port 3000
); }
